info.description: Public Workday REST APIs that enable you to access Workday Project data to plan and track your work for basic projects, nonbillable projects, billable projects, capital projects, and sales opportunities. It also enables you to integrate your projects with Workday Human Capital Management and Financial Management.
info.title: projects

get.summary: Retrieves a Resource Forecast Line Allocation for the specified ID.
get.description: Retrieves all resource forecast line allocations for the specified WID. Secured by: Manage: Project Resource Forecast Scope: Projects

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1145 | You can only update the current resource forecast.
A1169 | Forecasted Hours can't be greater than 24.
A1193 | To create or change a resource forecast line allocation, specify the ID of a resource forecast that Workday didn't generate.
A1208 | You can only use weekdays to create Resource Forecast Line Allocations.

post.description: Creates the forecasted hours for a resource forecast line for a given resource forecast for the project with the specified data. To create a single instance, specify the single JSON object in the request body. To create multiple instances, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: resourceForecastLine {id}, date (yyy-mm-dd), forecastedHours (numeric). This endpoint is equivalent to the Create Resource Forecast for Project task in Workday. Secured by: Manage: Project Resource Forecast Scope: Projects

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1123 | Use the PATCH operation to edit an existing Resource Forecast Line Allocation. A Resource Forecast Line Allocation already exists for this date: [date].
A1145 | You can only update the current resource forecast.
A1169 | Forecasted Hours can't be greater than 24.
A1193 | To create or change a resource forecast line allocation, specify the ID of a resource forecast that Workday didn't generate.
A1208 | You can only use weekdays to create Resource Forecast Line Allocations.

post.summary: Creates a Resource Plan Line Edit event and initiates the Project Resource Plan Line business process.
post.description: Special Processing If Resource Type is changed from Association to Assignment -Any Worker Group on the Resource Plan Line will be removed -Any Excluded Workers on the Resource Plan Line will be removed If Resource Type is changed from Assignment to Association -Any Workers on the Resource Plan Line will be removed -Any Unnamed Resources on the Resource Plan Line will be removed -The “To be hired" flag will be set to false -The % Allocation field will be set to 100% -The Estimated Hours field will be set to zero If To be hired is changed from True to False -Any Job Requisition on the Resource Plan Line will be removed If To be hired is changed from False to True -Any Workers on the Resource Plan Line will be removed -Any Unnamed Resources on the Resource Plan Line will be removed. To determine if business process validation errors occurred, inspect the businessEventValidation array in the response. Secured by: Patch \~Project\~ Resource Plan (REST Service) Scope: Project Tracking

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1113 | You can't create an unnamed resource if To Be Hired is true.
A1114 | If you specify Excluded Workers, the Resource Type must be Association.
A1115 | Ensure that the resource plan lines don't include workers in the same role with overlapping or blank assignment dates, and different standard cost rates or currencies.
A1116 | If you specify a Worker Group, the Resource Type must be Association.
A1127 | If you specify a Standard Cost Rate Override, you must specify a Standard Cost Rate Currency.
A1129 | Enter the number of new unnamed resources. You can't add unnamed resources using their reference IDs.
A1130 | Based on your security access, you can't add unnamed resources.
A1134 | Based on your security access, you can't enter a standard cost rate override.
A1136 | You can't have project resources if To Be Hired is true.
A1138 | You can't update a resource plan line for an inactive \~project\~.
A1147 | Based on your security access, you can't enter a standard cost currency override.
A1150 | Change the Resource Type or remove estimated hours and percent allocation. You can't reference estimated hours or percent allocation with the Resource Type set to Association.
A1156 | You can't change the resource type to Association when a worker is pending approval.
A1162 | Update the start or end date. The Resource End Date can't be before the Resource Start Date.
A1163 | Specify a valid Project Role ID. This ID is restricted to a different project hierarchy. Project Role ID: [id]
A1165 | You can't edit the resource plan line until the business process completes.
A1166 | You can't have a Job Requisition if To Be Hired is false.
A1176 | Specify each requirement only once. Duplicate requirements: [requirements].
A1177 | Specify only 1 requirement for these categories: [category].
A1180 | Change the Resource Type or remove the project resources. You can’t reference project resources with the Resource Type set to Association.
A1198 | Change the Resource Type or remove the unnamed resources. You can't create an unnamed resource with the Resource Type set to Association.
A1202 | You can't set To Be Hired to True when a worker is pending approval.
A1206 | Enter valid requirements for each category. Invalid requirements: [requirements].
A1209 | Enter a role for the resource plan line. Project Role is a required field.
A1210 | Resource Type must be Assignment or Association.
A1218 | Specify each requirement category only once. Duplicate categories: [categories].
A1224 | Enter valid requirement categories. Invalid categories: [categories].
A1787 | You must specify at least 1 \~worker\~, pending \~worker\~, or unnamed resource for a resource plan line associated with the quote for an open opportunity. [RPL ID]
A2014 | This worker [worker_name] is already assigned to this resource plan line. Specify a different worker.
A2015 | The same unnamed resource [unr_id] is swapped more than once in the same resource plan line. Specify unique unnamed resources.
A2016 | The unnamed resource [unrs] is invalid for the worker swap on this resource plan line. Specify a valid unnamed resource.
A2017 | To swap an Unnamed Resource with a Worker, specify a value in both fields.
A2018 | This worker [worker] is pending approval on this resource plan line. Specify a different worker.
A2019 | The same worker [worker] is swapped more than once in the same resource plan line. Specify unique workers.
A2020 | The unnamed resource [unr_id] is pending approval on this resource plan line. Specify a different unnamed resource.

post.summary: Creates Project Create Events and initiates the associated workflow to update the project.
post.description: Creates a Project Create Event business process and initiates the workflow to create the project with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: name, startDate, and primaryHierarchy. Secured by: Post \~Project\~ (REST Service) Scope: Project Tracking

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1110 | The End Date must be greater than the Start Date.
A1111 | Enter a worktag value for these worktag types: [types]
A1112 | A valid Project Hierarchy Reference Id is required.
A1118 | To enable Display Project in Opportunity Marketplace, contact your system administrator to opt in to Projects in Opportunity Marketplace.
A1120 | Basic customers cannot be referenced on a project. (project: [project]; customer: [customer])
A1124 | The currency for Estimated Budget ([ebcurrency]) must be the same as the Project Currency ([pcurrency]).
A1137 | Specify 0 for the probability of success when the project state is set to project.
A1142 | The external link isn't valid. Contact your security administrator for the correct link format.
A1143 | Company field is required for capital project
A1146 | Select an Optional \~Project\~ Hierarchy that is not part of the same optional hierarchy tree for this \~project\~. A \~project\~ must be uniquely assigned to an optional hierarchy tree.
A1168 | The currency for Estimated Revenue/Savings ([ercurrency]) must be the same as the Project Currency ([pcurrency]).
A1173 | Project Start Date is required.
A1174 | Add a Project Hierarchy Reference ID. This ID references an optional project hierarchy: [Project_Hierarchy_ID].
A1181 | Use only 1 worktag value for each worktag type: [worktags]
A1183 | Add an Optional Project Hierarchy Reference ID. This ID references a project hierarchy: [Project_Hierarchy_ID].
A1195 | \~Project\~ Name is required.
A1196 | Project Id already exists.  Reference Project: [Project Id]
A1199 | Currency field must match the company base currency for capital project
A1205 | You can't use these worktag values for the company: [worktags]
A1211 | You can't create a project for an inactive project hierarchy.
A1212 | The currency for Realized Revenue/Savings ([rrcurrency]) must be the same as the Project Currency ([pcurrency]).
A1217 | You can't use these worktag types for Projects: [worktags]
A1219 | Encountered Custom Validation Error(s): [errors]
A1225 | Currency is required because the \~project\~ has an estimated budget greater than zero.
A1232 | Validation error occurred. The entered information does not meet the restrictions defined for this field. (optionalHierarchies).
A1232 | Validation error occurred. The entered information does not meet the restrictions defined for this field. (projectDependencies).
A1252 | You can't use unapproved optional \~project\~ hierarchies to create a \~project\~.
A1253 | You can't use inactive optional \~project\~ hierarchies to create a \~project\~.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of ad hoc project time transactions.
get.description: Retrieves all ad hoc project time transactions. You can filter the transactions by project or project hierarchy. Secured by: Manage: Ad Hoc Project Costing, Process: Project Billing - Ad Hoc Project Transactions Scope: Project Billing, Projects

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: projectOrProjectHierarchy
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of a project or project hierarchy. You can use a returned project id or primaryHierarchy {id} from GET /projects.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates ad hoc project time transactions.
post.description: Creates an ad hoc project transaction instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: project{id}, worker{id}, billingStatus{id}, projectRole{id}, hours, transactionDate in yyyy-mm-dd format. This endpoint is equivalent to the Create Ad Hoc Project Transactions task, selecting Time as the transaction source. Secured by: Manage: Ad Hoc Project Costing, Process: Project Billing - Ad Hoc Project Transactions Scope: Project Billing, Projects

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---

A118 | Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
A998 | Enter a value 0 or higher for the standard cost rate.
A1108 | Enter a project role that is available for this project.
A1109 | \~Worker\~ does not meet restrictions for this transaction.
A1117 | Project is required and must have a value.
A1119 | Based on your security access, you cannot enter a rate to bill.
A1122 | For non-billable projects, enter Y for Include Cost.
A1125 | For non-billable projects, rate to bill does not apply.
A1133 | For non-billable projects, billing currency does not apply.
A1135 | \~Project\~, \~Project Phase\~, \~Project Task\~, and \~Project Role\~ worktags aren’t valid for this transaction.
A1139 | Enter Y for Include Cost if you specify a standard cost rate override or standard cost currency override.
A1144 | Enter Billing Status for Ad Hoc \~Project\~ Transaction.
A1144 | Enter Billing Status for Ad Hoc \~Project\~ Transaction.
A1148 | Enter \~Worker\~ for Ad Hoc \~Project\~ Transaction.
A1149 | Enter Transaction Date for Ad Hoc \~Project\~ Transaction.
A1158 | Based on your security access, you can create ad hoc \~project\~ transactions only for billable \~projects\~.
A1161 | Enter \~Project Plan Task\~ for Ad Hoc \~Project\~ Transaction.
A1168 | The Worktags provided are not valid for this transaction
A1172 | Based on your security access, your Billing Status can either be Do Not Bill or Awaiting Review.
A1184 | Enter a non-zero value.
A1189 | Based on your security access, you cannot enter a standard cost currency override.
A1203 | Based on your security access, you cannot enter a standard cost rate override.
A1204 | \~Project plan task\~ does not meet restrictions defined for this field.
A1220 | Based on your security access, you can't enter a billing currency.
A1221 | The \~Contingent Worker\~ or \~Employee\~ worktag does not match the \~worker\~ on the transaction.
A1232 | Validation error occurred. The entered information does not meet the restrictions defined for this field. (worktags).

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of Project Plan Tasks for a specified Project or Project Plan Phase.
get.description: Retrieves all project plan tasks for a project or project phase. Contains a Delete flag. You can specify 0 to delete the Project Plan task, or specify 1 to prevent deleting the Project Plan task. You can filter the project plan tasks by Project, or ProjectPlanPhase {id}. Secured by: Manage: Project Plan Scope: Project Tracking

parameters.name: filterBy
parameters.description: Accepts both Project Plan Phase or Project Plan Task WID. Query helps to filter results set based on filterCondition either to include or exclude WIDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1155 | The Project Reference provided refers to a Project that is not updatable either because the Project was never created or the Project was Canceled or Denied. Project Reference: [id], [reference]
A1187 | Indicates the Project is inactive.  A project may also be inactivated by a project hierarchy as indicated by the 'Inactivated By Hierarchy Reference'.  In which case, the project is considered Inactive even though this Boolean returns False.  Changes to an inactive project are ignored.  Reactivating a project can only be done on the project if it was explicitly marked 'Inactive' or by reactivating the hierarchy that made the project inactive.

--- | ---

A1140 | Enter a name for the project. This field is required.
A1153 | Project Phase Reference is required when creating a new Project Plan Phase for Project.

In which case, the project is considered Inactive even though this Boolean returns False.  Changes to an inactive project are ignored.  Reactivating a project can only be done on the project if it was explicitly marked 'Inactive' or by reactivating the hierarchy that made the project inactive.
A1849 | Ensure that you have permissions to create new project plan phases for this project.
